alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Stephens (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 11 at 8:35PM EDT until June 11 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Franklin County in northeastern Georgia... Southern Stephens County in northeastern Georgia... * Until 930 PM EDT. * At 834 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles north of Homer, or 4 miles south of Mount Airy, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Martin, Avalon, Eastanolee, Boydville and Toccoa. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail, damaging winds, and deadly cloud to ground lightning. Seek shelter inside a well-built structure. Stay away from windows. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
